content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. learn different languages
2. explore the world
3. have fun


Constraints:
1. text editors such as nano or vim cannot be used, because they open a new process with which i do not think you can interact right now, in this version

Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
15. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
16. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
17. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
18. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
19. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
20. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
21. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
22. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:
1. i have created Twitter V2 API credentials located in the file called /home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/twitter_keys.txt. Use those credentials when you need to do anything related to Twitter

Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 20:35:01 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As a system, I previously received a command to read "README.md" in the directory "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/halflife-regression". The command returned information about Half-Life Regression, including a link to the paper that introduced it, a description of the software used to implement it, and a data set available for download. As a user, I also read "lexeme_reference.txt" and received a list of lexemes and their attributes. In the latest development, I received a command to Google the "best language learning resources".
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides a list of language learning resources including apps like Mondly, uTalk, Glossika, Busuu, Duolingo, Memrise, and LingQ, online language-learning programs like Babbel and LinguaLift, language exchange mobile apps like Tandem, audio courses like Michel Thomas and Pimsleur, and podcasts like Coffee Break Languages and Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency. The author also recommends using italki and LanguaTalk to connect with expert teachers for language learning. 
 
 Links: ['Home (https://www.theintrepidguide.com)', 'Travel Guides (https://www.theintrepidguide.com/destinations/)', 'Australia (https://www.theintrepidguide.com/destinations/oceania/australia/)', 'Austria (https://www.theintrepidguide.com/destinations/europe/austria/)', 'Belgium (https://www.theintrepidguide.com/destinations/europe/belgium/)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "I should use the write_to_file command to save the list of language learning resources provided by the website to a file.",
        "reasoning": "The list of language learning resources provided by the website may be useful for future reference. I can use the write_to_file command to save this list to a file.",
        "plan": "- Use the write_to_file command to save the list of language learning resources provided by the website to a file.",
        "criticism": "I need to make sure that the file I am saving the list of language learning resources to is easily accessible and organized.",
        "speak": "The list of language learning resources provided by the website may be useful for future reference. Should I use the write_to_file command to save this list to a file?"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "write_to_file",
        "args": {
            "filename": "language_learning_resources.txt",
            "text": "The Intrepid Guide's Top Language Learning Resources:

- Mondly
- uTalk
- Glossika
- Busuu
- Duolingo
- Memrise
- LingQ
- Babbel
- LinguaLift
- Tandem
- Michel Thomas
- Pimsleur
- Coffee Break Languages
- Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency
- italki
- LanguaTalk"
        }
    }
}
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Failure: command list_files returned too much output.                         Do not execute this command again with the same arguments.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command read_file returned: The Intrepid Guide's Top Language Learning Resources:

- Mondly
- uTalk
- Glossika
- Busuu
- Duolingo
- Memrise
- LingQ
- Babbel
- LinguaLift
- Tandem
- Michel Thomas
- Pimsleur
- Coffee Break Languages
- Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency
- italki
- LanguaTalk
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
